properties.Incident d: Pirates in a skiff chased, fired upon, boarded and hijacked a chemical tanker underway and took its 18 crew members as hostage. The tanker sailed towards Somalia.

properties.Incident d: Four robbers armed with knives boarded an anchored tanker unnoticed and entered the engine room. They took hostage the 2/E and motorman, forcing them to open the spares store room and tied their hands. The robbers stole ships spares and escaped. The duty
properties.Consequenc: 2/E and motorman taken hostage. Engine spares stolen
properties.Action tak: The duty crew freed themselves and alerted the master

properties.Incident d: Seven pirates in a small flat bottomed boat chased and attempted to board a bulk carrier underway. The vessel took anti-piracy measures, rigged fire hoses, increased speed, made evasive manoeuvres and sounded ship's whistle, resulting in the attack being
properties.Action tak: The vessel took anti-piracy measures, rigged fire hoses, increased speed, made evasive manoeuvres and sounded ship's whistle

properties.Incident d: The duty A/B noticed one robber at starboard hawse pipe, trying to break open the lock. One boat was noticed nearby with two more persons onboard. Alarm raised, crew mustered. The robber jumped into the water and escaped in the waiting boat. Nothing stol
properties.Action tak: The master raised the alarm and crew mustered

properties.Incident d: Around 10 pirates armed with guns boarded the drifting tanker. The pirates destroyed the communication equipment, stole the ship?s cash and property, the crew's cash and personal belongings and escaped. One crew was injured during the incident.
properties.Consequenc: The pirates destroyed the communication equipment, stole the ship?s cash and property, the crew's cash and belongings. One crew was injured

properties.Incident d: While at anchor, a group of robbers boarded the vessel by breaking the padlock of secured steel plate of hawse pipe and escaped with six immersion suits and the starboard life raft.
properties.Consequenc: The robbers escaped with six immersion suits and the starboard life raft. The robbers also broke the portside life raft padlock and skylight padlock.
properties.Action tak: On discovering the broken padlock, the ship's crew mustered and carried out a thorough search of the vessel and reported the incident to Manila Port Control

properties.Incident d: About five pirates armed with guns in a skiff chased and fired upon a bulk carrier underway.  The onboard security team returned fire and the skiff turned away and aborted the attack.
properties.Consequenc: Pirates fired upon the vessel
properties.Action tak: The onboard security team returned fire at the pirates

properties.Incident d: Pirates in a skiff chased and attempted to board the ship underway. The ship enforced anti-piracy measures, increased speed and made evasive manoeuvres, resulting in the pirates moving away.
properties.Action tak: Ship enforced anti-piracy measures, increased speed and made evasive manoeuvres

properties.Incident d: Four pirates in a skiff maintained a parallel course with the tanker before suddenly increasing speed to 25 knots and coming alongside in an attempt to board. No ladders were seen on the skiff. The master raised the alarm, commenced evasive manoeuvres an
properties.Action tak: The master raised the alarm, commenced evasive manoeuvres and non-essential crew retreated into the citadel

properties.Incident d: Six pirates in a skiff approached a bulk carrier underway. The master contacted a warship in the vicinity when the skiff came to a distance of 2.5 NM.  The naval warship responded and a helicopter was launched. The alarm was raised, non-essential crew mu
properties.Action tak: The master raised the alarm

properties.Incident d: Two robbers armed with knives boarded an anchored ship unnoticed, stole ship?s stores and escaped. The duty crew noticed the theft during their routine rounds and raised the alarm. Port control was informed and a patrol boat sent out for investigation.
properties.Consequenc: Robbers stole ship?s stores
properties.Action tak: Raised alarm and the crew searched the vessel

properties.Incident d: While at anchor, the vessel was boarded by an unidentified number of robbers armed with knives. The robbers took the duty watch sentry hostage at knife point and stole engine spare parts and escaped.
properties.Consequenc: The robber escaped with spare parts of reefer container, portable lights, mobile phone, torch, three fire hose with nozzles, hydraulic jack and six immersion suits. No crew were injured
properties.Action tak: The crew raised the alarm

properties.Incident d: While underway, the ship was pursued by 16 pirates in four skiffs for about 20 mins.  Two skiffs approached the ship on her port and starboard quarters, closing to about 500 metres from the ship. The ship had employed private armed guards for this voyage
properties.Consequenc: The pirates aborted the chase
properties.Action tak: The ship had employed BMP4 measures, with barb wire in place and fire hoses charged

properties.Incident d: About eight pirates in a skiff and armed with AK47s attacked the container from a fishing trawler and fired upon and attempted to board the ship underway. The Master increased speed, took evasive manoeuvres and the crew mustered in the citadel. Later, th
properties.Consequenc: Pirates fired upon the ship, made bullet holes on the accommodation block and two holes in port side life boat
properties.Action tak: The master increased speed, took evasive manoeuvres and the crew mustered in the citadel

properties.Incident d: A suspicious boat approached the drifting ship. The duty crew spotted the boat and raised the alarm. The boat closed onto and fired upon the ship. All the crew retreated into the citadel. After nearly 12 hours the crew emerged from the citadel and found
properties.Consequenc: The pirates fired upon and boarded the ship. They ransacked the crew's cabins and stole cash and ship?s stores
properties.Action tak: The master raised alarm, activated SSAS and all crew retreated into the citadel

properties.Incident d: Two robbers armed with long knives boarded an anchored ship. They took hostage the duty watchman, stole his VHF, the ship?s stores and escaped. The watchman informed bridge who raised the alarm. Port control was informed.
properties.Consequenc: The robbers took hostage the duty watchman, stole his VHF and the ship?s stores
properties.Action tak: Alarm raised and crew mustered

properties.Incident d: Three robbers armed with long knives boarded a tanker via the anchor chain. They were spotted by the duty A/B who reported to the bridge duty officer. The alarm was raised. The robbers stole ship's stores and escaped in their waiting boat.
properties.Consequenc: Ship's stores were stolen
properties.Action tak: The master raised the alarm and crew alerted

properties.Incident d: Six pirates in a skiff approached, fired upon and attempted to board from the stern the naval auxiliary ship underway. The naval force protection team on the ship returned fire in self-defence, forcing the pirates to abort the attempted attack. The ship?
properties.Consequenc: Pirates fired upon the ship
properties.Action tak: The naval force protection team returned fire

properties.Incident d: The vessel was approached by 2 pirate skiffs, one on each quarter, speed 18-20kts at a distance of 3-4 miles. One skiff approached to 1NM, the onboard AST fired warning shots, the pirates returned fire, but vessel well out of range of their weapons. AST
properties.Consequenc: All crew members well, no consequenses for ship, crew or cargo.
properties.Action tak: The master activated SSAS. The master, working closely with security team leader, gave permission for warning shots to be fired. Crew mustered in citadel.

properties.Incident d: Five robbers boarded an anchored ship via the forecastle while duty crew were busy tending to cargo operations. When duty crew returned to forecastle, he saw two robbers who pushed him and escaped in a waiting boat. On investigating, it was noticed that
properties.Consequenc: Robbers stole ship?s stores
properties.Action tak: The master raised alarm and the crew mustered

properties.Incident d: Four robbers wearing masks, armed with choppers and knives in a boat approached an anchored ship. Two of the robbers attempted to board the ship by climbing the anchor chain. The duty crew noticed the robbers and informed bridge, who raised the alarm. Th
properties.Action tak: The master raised the alarm, the crew mustered and activated fire hoses

properties.Incident d:
Lookouts onboard a tanker underway noticed six pirates in a skiff approaching their vessel at a distance of 3.5 NM. At a distance of around 300m, 
the onboard unarmed security team engaged the skiff with the LRAD and the non-essential crew members muster

While underway, six pirates onboard a skiff that had been launched from a mother ship (dhow) approached the vessel. The military Vessel Protection Detachment (VPD) onboard the vessel shot flares to deter the pirates. When the pirates continued their appr
properties.Action tak: The crew entered citadel during attack.

properties.Incident d: The duty personnel discovered that two life rafts were missing when they were doing their security rounds. There was no sign of the robbers onboard the tanker at that time when the loss was discovered.
properties.Consequenc: Two life rafts were stolen from the port side. All crew was safe.

properties.Incident d: Twelve pirates in skiff approached the tanker underway. As the skiff approached the tanker, ladders were sighted. The alarm was raised, non-essential crew mustered in the citadel and the master took anti-piracy measures. As the skiff manoeuvred towards t
properties.Action tak: The alarm was raised, non-essential crew mustered in the citadel and the master took anti-piracy measures. The armed security team onboard fired warning shots

properties.Incident d: The duty watchman onboard an anchored bulk carrier heard a small boat approach the vessel. He then noticed movement on the forecastle deck and informed the duty officer. On reaching the forecastle, the duty watchman and the duty officer noticed a robber
properties.Consequenc: One crew member injured and the robbers stole the ship's stores
properties.Action tak: The master raised the alarm

properties.Incident d: Some robbers boarded the ship whilst awaiting for the pilot. The duty watchman spotted the robbers and informed the Master.  The Master raised  the alarm and reported to the coast guard.  The robbers noticed crew alertness and escaped with stolen stores.
properties.Consequenc: Robbers stole ship?s stores.
properties.Action tak: The master raised the alarm and the crew mustered.

properties.Incident d: While at anchor, five robbers boarded the vessel from two small boats and escaped with three mooring ropes.
properties.Consequenc: Three mooring ropes were stolen.  No crew sustained any injuries
properties.Action tak: The crew informed the port authorities and Bangladesh Coast Guard

properties.Incident d: Four robbers armed with knives boarded an anchored tanker. They entered the engine room, tied up the duty engineer and stole ship's stores. They took the duty engineer to the stern and disembarked on to a waiting boat. No injuries to the crew.
properties.Consequenc: Robbers took hostage and tied up the duty engineer and stole ship's stores
properties.Action tak: The master raised the alarm and crew mustered

properties.Incident d: Armed robbers boarded an anchored tanker and held the duty motor man as hostage. The duty 3/E noticed the robbers and informed the duty officer who raised the alarm. On hearing the alarm, the robbers escaped with engine spares. No injuries to the crew.
properties.Consequenc: Robbers held the duty motor man as hostage and stole engine spares
properties.Action tak: The master raised the alarm and crew mustered

properties.Incident d: Two skiffs with five robbers in each skiff approached a chemical tanker underway. The vessel enforced anti-piracy measures, increased speed and deployed the security team. When the skiffs approached closer to the vessel, the security team fired warning f
properties.Action tak: The master raised the alarm and the crew mustered, the vessel increased speed and the security team fired warning flares

properties.Incident d: The security team onboard a bulk carrier underway reported two skiffs approaching the vessel. There were a total of seven skiffs in the vicinity. The first skiff had six pirates armed with AK47s. No weapons were seen in the second skiff which had four pi
properties.Action tak: The master enforced anti-piracy measures and deployed armed guards

properties.Incident d: Ten robbers boarded an anchored ship, stole the ship's stores and escaped unnoticed. During the security patrol by A/B sentry detected a small boat tied at the aft with an unidentified number of robbers.
properties.Consequenc: Ship's stores and machinery spares were stolen. No crew were injured
properties.Action tak: The sentry raised alarm and alerted the duty officer

properties.Incident d: Three suspected armed pirates in black military uniforms chased the ship underway in a white hulled speed boat. The ship increased speed, made evasive manoeuvres and the crew mustered. The boat aborted the attempt and moved away after chasing the ship fo
properties.Consequenc: Pirates chased the ship
properties.Action tak: The ship enforced anti-piracy measures, increased speed and the crew mustered

properties.Incident d: Four robbers in a small unlit boat approached an anchored ship. The deck watch crew noticed the robbers climbing up the anchor chain trying to remove the hawse pipe cover and informed the bridge. OOW immediately raised the alarm and activated the fire pu
properties.Action tak: The master raised the alarm and activated the fire pump to start anchor wash

properties.Incident d: Eight robbers armed with long knives boarded an anchored ship. They took the duty A/B hostage, forced him into the bosun store and tied him up. The robbers stole ship?s stores and escaped. As the A/B was not answering calls on the walkie talkie, a search
properties.Consequenc: The robbers took hostage the duty A/B, forced him into the bosun store and tied him up. The robbers stole ship?s stores
properties.Action tak: The master ordered crew to search for the A/B and tried to contact port control

properties.Incident d: Robbers boarded an anchored tanker. Duty A/B on rounds sighted the robbers armed with long knives and immediately informed the duty officer. Seeing crew alertness, the robbers escaped with the ship's stores.
properties.Consequenc: Robbers stole ship?s stores
properties.Action tak: The master raised the alarm and crew mustered

properties.Incident d: Four robbers armed with a gun and knives boarded an anchored ship during cargo operations. The robbers tried to attack the duty A/B, who managed to escape and inform the 2/O. Alarm raised and all crew mustered and proceeded towards the robbers. The robbe
properties.Consequenc: The robbers tried to attack the duty A/B and stole the ship?s stores. The robbers fired four shots before escaping
properties.Action tak: Alarm raised and crew mustered

properties.Incident d: A general cargo ship underway noticed a mother vessel lowering a skiff. The skiff with five armed pirates was seen approaching the ship. The onboard armed security team fired warning flares which were ignored by the skiff. As the skiff approached the shi
properties.Action tak: The armed security team fired warning flares and warning shots

properties.Incident d: Five robbers in a canoe approached an anchored vessel during heavy rain. One of the robbers boarded the vessel and stole the ship's stores. C/O on watch noticed the robber with a long knife on the main deck and raised the alarm. Crew mustered and shouted
properties.Consequenc: Ship?s stores stolen
properties.Action tak: The master raised the alarm, the crew mustered and shouted at the robber

properties.Incident d: Two robbers boarded a tanker during STS operations using a rope attached to a hook. The duty pump man noticed the robbers and raised the alarm. The robbers removed the hook and jumped into the water and escaped in their small boat empty-handed.
properties.Action tak: The master raised the alarm

properties.Incident d: During transit in convoy with a Chinese Naval Ship, a suspicious mother ship was observed drifting with 2 skiffs in tow.
properties.Action tak: Observe for suspicious activities

properties.Incident d: Robbers boarded an anchored tanker, stole ship's stores and escaped unnoticed.
properties.Consequenc: Ship?s stores stolen
properties.Action tak: Reported to CSO

properties.Incident d: While en route from Singapore to Pasir Gudang, Malaysia, 10 small boats surrounded the barge and two robbers boarded the barge from a small boat. A Singapore Navy ship was in the vicinity of the tug boat and barge. On seeing the presence of the navy ship
properties.Consequenc: The robbers escaped with some scrap iron
properties.Action tak: All 7 crew onboard the tug were reported to be safe

properties.Incident d: While at anchor, approximately seven to eight robbers boarded the ship from a small rubber dinghy and held a duty watchman hostage. The robbers escaped with ship's stores.
properties.Consequenc: Ship's stores were stolen. No crew were injured
properties.Action tak: The master informed the port authorities. The vessel enhanced security level/measures onboard

properties.Incident d: Suspicious vessel observed on radar. The ship changed course several times to increase the distance to the approaching boat, but the suspicious vessel countered each course change.
properties.Action tak: Ship set course for naval force position after consultation with private security advisors

properties.Incident d: Duty watch onboard an anchored container ship noticed wet footprints on the deck and the padlock to the bowthruster room broken. He informed the OOW who noticed a small boat alongside the vessel near the starboard midship. OOW raised the alarm and crew m
properties.Consequenc: Ship?s stores and equipment stolen
properties.Action tak: Raised alarm and crew mustered

properties.Incident d: Two knife wielding robbers embarked and gained access to the engine room.
properties.Consequenc: On watch oiler was noticeably disturbed by the incident
properties.Action tak: Second Officer as security watchman alerted the chief engineer and the master. A public address announcement was made, the crew mustered, including the oiler.

properties.Incident d: Pirates in two white skiffs approached a chemical tanker underway. OOW informed the master who raised the alarm and activated anti-piracy measures. As the skiffs approached, the onboard armed team fired warning shots which were ignored by the skiffs. As
properties.Consequenc: Pirates chased the ship
properties.Action tak: The tanker enforced anti-piracy measures, sent a distress message and armed guards fired warning shots

properties.Incident d: Three skiffs with six to seven robbers in each skiff chased the ship and approached within 200 metres with intent to board. The ship enforced anti-piracy measures and contacted warship on VHF. The skiffs aborted the attack.
properties.Action tak: The ship enforced anti-piracy measures and contacted warship on VHF

properties.Incident d: Robbers in two skiffs chased the tanker underway and approached within 0.2 nm. The tanker enforced anti-piracy measures, altered course and managed to evade the attack.
properties.Action tak: The tanker enforced anti-piracy measures and altered course

properties.Incident d: Eight robbers in a skiff chased a chemical tanker underway and approached her within 100m. The tanker enforced anti-piracy measures, made evasive manoeuvres and all non essential crew mustered in citadel. The robbers aborted the attack and moved away.
properties.Consequenc: Robbers chased the tanker
properties.Action tak: Alarm raised and all crew mustered

properties.Incident d: The vessel was en route from Adabiya, Egypt, to Singapore and carrying 19,475m of steel cable and a crew of 21 on board. Pirates attacked and hijacked the ship underway. Pirates sailed the ship towards the Somalian coast.
properties.Consequenc: The vessel was hijacked and took hostage 21 crew

properties.Incident d: Three robbers armed with rods boarded an anchored product tanker. Duty crew on rounds sighted the robbers on the poop deck and immediately raised the alarm. Seeing the alert crew, robbers escaped empty handed. Incident was reported to the Port Authoritie
properties.Consequenc: Robbers boarded the ship
properties.Action tak: Alarm raised and crew mustered

properties.Incident d: The OOW onboard the VLCC tanker sighted two skiffs approaching. The tanker increased speed to maximum and made evasive manoeuvres and enforced anti-piracy measures. The skiff had five pirates carrying guns and a ladder. The onboard security team fired wa
properties.Consequenc: Pirates chased the tanker
properties.Action tak: The tanker enforced anti-piracy measures and the onboard armed security team fired warning shots

properties.Incident d: Four robbers armed with long knives boarded an offshore supply ship. Robbers stole ship's stores. Robbers threatened duty watchmen with long knives and escaped in a canoe. All crew safe and no casualties.
properties.Consequenc: Robbers boarded the vessel, threatened duty crew and stole ship's stores

properties.Incident d: Pirates boarded and hijacked a product tanker drifting whilst awaiting orders and sailed to an unknown location. The IMB Piracy Reporting Centre contacted and liaised with the Nigerian authorities and a rescue team from the navy was dispatched and interc
properties.Consequenc: Tanker hijacked and crew injured

properties.Incident d: C/O onboard a container ship underway noticed two suspicious boats in the vicinity. He informed the master and started tracking the boats. It was observed that a red hull fishing vessel and a white skiff were chasing the ship. The skiff was observed to b
properties.Action tak: Alarm raised, fire pump on standby, made evasive manoeuvres

properties.Incident d: Robbers boarded an anchored general cargo ship, stole ship's stores and escaped unnoticed. The incident was reported to the local authorities.
properties.Consequenc: Ship's stores stolen

properties.Incident d: A general cargo vessel underway noticed on the radar two boats approaching from astern. As the boats closed in, they fired at the vessel. Alarm was raised and crew mustered in a safe area. The boats chased the vessel for around 25 minutes before aborting
properties.Consequenc: Fired on the vessel
properties.Action tak: Raised alarm, crew mustered

properties.Incident d: A gang of seven robbers boarded an anchored bulk carrier using a hook and rope. Duty A/B noticed the robbers and informed bridge who raised the alarm. All crew mustered. The robbers threatened the A/B with knives, broke the forepeak store lock and stole
properties.Consequenc: Crew threatened and ship?s stores stolen

properties.Incident d: Armed pirates chased and fired on a drifting bulk carrier. The vessel raised the alarm and headed towards Lagos. All crew except the bridge team took shelter in the citadel. The Captain and the C/E were shot during the firing. The IMB Piracy Reporting Ce
properties.Consequenc: Pirates fired at the vessel. Some crew members sustained injuries and the Captain and the C/Engineer were fatally wounded
properties.Action tak: Sent distress message

properties.Incident d: While at anchor, approximately seven to eight robbers boarded the vessel from a small rubber dinghy. On boarding the vessel, the duty watchman was taken hostage and the robbers escaped with the ship's stores.  While towing barge L K H 3883, from Singapor
properties.Consequenc: Ship's stores were stolen. No crew were injured
properties.Action tak: The master informed the port authorities. The vessel enhanced security level/measures onboard

properties.Incident d: Ship was approaching an area congested with fishing vessels.  The ship was approached by three skiffs. Armed security fired a warning shot, which caused the skiffs to leave.
properties.Action tak: The master sounded general alarm. The crew mustered to safe room. The accommodation was secured. The security team manned bridge wings and fired a warning shot

properties.Incident d: Seven robbers in two skiffs chased a chemical tanker underway. The master raised the alarm, altered course and the onboard armed security team fired hand flares followed by a warning shot, resulting in the robbers aborting the attack and moving away.
properties.Action tak: The master raised the alarm, altered course, the onboard security team fired hand flares and warning shots

properties.Incident d: About 20 robbers in two boats approached the anchored tanker and attempted to board. The lookout crew noticed the robbers, raised the alarm and crew mustered. The robbers aborted the attack on seeing the crew's alertness and moved away.
properties.Consequenc: The robbers aborted the attempt after seeing that the crew had been alerted. The crew did not suffer any injury.
properties.Action tak: Alarm raised and all crew mustered

properties.Incident d: OOW on board an anchored chemical tanker noticed two heavily armed pirates on deck and raised the alarm. The master contacted the navy. but received no response. Non-essential crew locked themselves in a safe location. The pirates made their way to the b
properties.Consequenc: Pirates boarded the tanker, instructed the master and crew to sailed to an unknown location

properties.Incident d: While sailing, the vessel was chased by a skiff with pirates armed with machine guns and rocket propelled grenades. Two warning shots were fired by the armed guards and simultaneously, the pirates also fired two shots and retreated in a southerly directi
properties.Consequenc: The ship did not sustain any damage and no crew was injured
properties.Action tak: The master raised the alarm and all crew mustered in citadel. The armed guards were authorized by the master to fire two warning shots

properties.Incident d: Chased by two skiffs. Attack averted by the ship's manoeuvres and warning shots.
properties.Action tak: Evasive manoeuvres, water spray from fire hoses and use of scarecrows

properties.Incident d: The tanker underway sighted a skiff of four to six pirates approaching at around 20 knots. A suspicious dhow was sighted in the vicinity. The master sent a distress message to navies and informed UKMTO. As the skiff approached at 1.6 nm, weapons were sig
properties.Consequenc: Pirates fired on the tanker. There were no damage to ship and no crew were injured.
properties.Action tak: The master raised the alarm, sent a Mayday message, informed UKMTO and altered course to move away from the pirate skiff.  The crew mustered in a safe room and the onboard armed security team exchanged fire with the pirates.

properties.Incident d: While sailing, the vessel was approached by two fishing boats and boarded by four robbers armed with long knives. On entering the engine room, the robbers tied the engine room rating. Duty engineer on a chemical tanker under pilotage raised the alarm whe
properties.Consequenc: Robbers tied up a crew member
properties.Action tak: Chief Engineer raised the alarm

properties.Incident d: A container ship underway noticed two skiffs at a distance of 2nm approaching her at high speed. The master raised the alarm, activated SSAS, altered course, non-essential crew mustered in the citadel, and the onboard armed guards took their position. Th
properties.Consequenc: The ship did not sustain any damage and no crew was injured.
properties.Action tak: Non essential crew took shelter in the citadel. The master initiated evasive manoeuvres and activated SSAS. The security team fired two warning shots.

properties.Incident d: While sailing, the vessel was pursued by suspected skiffs. Initially three skiffs were detected on ship?s radar. One skiff was at 5nm on starboard bow and the other two skiffs with approximately five to six pirates, near the starboard beam of the ship an
properties.Consequenc: The ship did not sustain any damage and no crew was injured.
properties.Action tak: The crew proceeded to citadel. The master raised SSAS and distress alert.

properties.Incident d: An unlit speed boat approached the tug towing a barge (Crest 282). The speed boat came alongside the tug and four robbers boarded the tug while two remained in the boat. The robbers wearing masks and armed with guns and knives took hostage the C/E and 3/
properties.Consequenc: The robbers took hostage the C/E and 3/E. All crew except the bridge crew were taken hostage. The robbers took away a laptop and some valuables from the crew before leaving the tug boat. No crew were injured.
properties.Action tak: The 2/O raised the alarm

properties.Incident d: Three robbers in a canoe, armed with knives, boarded an anchored offshore supply ship from the port side main deck. One robber threatened the watchkeeper with a knife while the other two took the pressure washer and ran away. The master raised the alarm.
properties.Consequenc: One robber threatened the watch man with a knife while the other two robbers stole the pressure washer. The crew did not suffer any injury.
properties.Action tak: Raised alarm and crew mustered

properties.Incident d: A bulk carrier underway noticed nine skiffs approaching aggressively at starboard side and one skiff at port side. The master raised the alarm, increased speed and began evasive manoeuvres. One skiff with 10-15 robbers onboard closed in to a distance of
properties.Action tak: The master raised the alarm, increased speed, made evasive manoeuvres. The onboard security team fired warning shots

properties.Incident d: While underway, the tanker spotted 3-4 pirates in a skiff heading towards the tanker at a speed of more than 20 knots. The master raised the alarm, made evasive manoeuvres, activated fire pumps and the armed security team made their presence known. Later
properties.Consequenc: The pirates chased the tanker
properties.Action tak: Raised alarm, made evasive manoeuvres and started the fire pump

properties.Incident d: The ship was followed by a skiff; AK-47 was identified.  Attack averted by enforcing anti-piracy measures (BMP) as well as the presence of a coalition forces? helicopter.
properties.Action tak: Alarm sounded, crew mustered in citadel

properties.Incident d: 12 pirates armed with AK-47s in a skiff boarded and hijacked a dhow underway.
properties.Consequenc: Pirates hijacked the fishing dhow

properties.Incident d: Eight robbers armed with guns in a wooden boat boarded and started firing towards the bridge and galley on an anchored ship. The robbers ransacked the ship and stole the crew's cash, personnel effects, the ship's cash and property. They took hostage the
properties.Consequenc: The robbers fired at the bridge and galley. They ransacked the ship and stole the crew's cash, personnel effects, the ship's cash and property. They took hostage the master and C/E. One crew wounded and one crew unaccounted for
properties.Action tak: The ship sailed to a safe distance

properties.Incident d: While the tug boat was towing a barge Toll 3310 from Singapore to Pasir Gudang (Malaysia), eight small boats came alongside the barge. An unknown number of robbers boarded the barge and escaped with some scrap iron. A few boats continued to remain in the
properties.Consequenc: The robbers escaped with some scrap iron. The crew did not suffer any injuries
properties.Action tak: The crew on the tug boat maintained vigilence and continued the voyage to Pasir Gudang

properties.Incident d: Robbers boarded a container ship at anchor. Robbers stole ship's stores and escaped unnoticed with four mooring ropes. The master informed the port authority and local agent.
properties.Consequenc: Robbers boarded the ship and stole ship?s stores. The crew did not sustain any injury.
properties.Action tak: The Master reported to Port Authorities.

properties.Incident d: Seven to eight armed robbers in a boat chased and fired at a chemical tanker underway. The alarm was raised, crew mustered on bridge and all access to accommodation secured from the inside. The robbers chased the tanker for one hour before aborting and m

properties.Action tak: The master raised the alarm, mustered all crew and secured access to accommodation

properties.Incident d: Five to seven robbers attacked the ship during loading operation. Duty watchman noticed the robbers arriving in a speed boat and attaching chain and line to climb from ship's bow. After the Duty watchman sounded the alarm he rushed to the bow with the cr
properties.Consequenc: No crew injury but all padlocks on the doors and secure block on the forecastle main cover were damaged. Two mooring ropes were also stlen
properties.Action tak: Duty watchman activated the alarm and went to the bow along with the crew

properties.Incident d: Armed pirates attacked the dhow underway en route from Mukalla to Socotra Island. They took hostage 6 crew members, hijacked the dhow and sailed the ship towards Somalia.
properties.Consequenc: The pirates took hostage six crew members and hijacked the dhow

properties.Incident d: Armed pirates in a skiff hijacked a tanker underway. The hijackers took hostage 22 crew members and sailed the tanker towards the coast of Somalia.
properties.Consequenc: Tanker hijacked and 22 crew members taken as hostage

properties.Incident d: While at anchor, 10 robbers armed with knives boarded the bulk carrier from two motor boats via the forecastle. The duty watchman saw the robbers and raised the alarm. Seeing crew alertness, the robbers escaped in two boats with stolen ship's stores. The
properties.Consequenc: The robbers escaped in two boats with stolen ship's stores. No crew were injured
properties.Action tak: The master raised the alarm and informed the Port Control and the local agent

properties.Incident d: Duty deck crew onboard an anchored offshore supply ship was attacked and injured by a robber armed with a knife. The alarm was raised and the crew mustered. Seeing crew alertness, the robber escaped empty handed. Injured crew member was given first aid.
properties.Consequenc: The duty deck crew was attacked and sustained injuries
properties.Action tak: The master raised the alarm and crew mustered

properties.Incident d: While sailing, the ship was pursued by approximately four to six pirates in a skiff. Pirates approached and fired on the ship.
properties.Consequenc: The ship did not sustain any damage and no crew was injured.
properties.Action tak: The armed guards were authorized by the master to fire a warning shot

properties.Incident d: Seven heavily armed persons in a speed boat approached a chemical tanker underway. The tanker raised the alarm, increased speed and set course away from land. The armed naval guards onboard the vessel made their presence known. Later, the persons in the
properties.Action tak: The master raised the alarm, increased speed and set course away from land. The armed naval guards onboard the vessel made their presence known

properties.Consequenc: Robbers stole ship?s stores. The crew did not sustain any injuries

properties.Consequenc: No crew injury. Some of vessel's windows were found broken and internal and cabin doors also sustained damages

properties.Action tak: The master altered course and the security team fired warning shots

properties.Action tak: The master raised the alarm, altered course, sent a distress message and the security team launched a rocket flare and fired warning shots

properties.Consequenc: Pirates took hostage 23 crew members and hijacked the ship

properties.Action tak: A security check was conducted thereafter and no items were stolen from the vessel. The master reported the incident to the Port Authorities.

properties.Consequenc: Pirates fired on the vessel.

properties.Consequenc: The pirates attacked and boarded the ship. They took hostage the crew members and hijacked the ship

properties.Action tak: The master raised the alarm, alerted onboard armed security team and fired two rocket flares

properties.Consequenc: Armed robbers hijacked the tanker and took hostage 24 crew members.

properties.Consequenc: Pirates damaged the bridge window and stole ship?s property

properties.Consequenc: The crew did not sustain any injuries and there was no damage to ship

properties.Consequenc: Robbers boarded the ship and threatened the crew with long knives

properties.Consequenc: The crew did not sustain any injuries. The cabin doors and communication equipment were damaged. The pirates stole the crew?s personal belongings and cash
properties.Action tak: The chief officer informed the sister ship which relayed the message to the shipping company

properties.Consequenc: The crew were hit by the robbers but did not sustain serious injuries. The cabin doors were damaged

properties.Consequenc: Ship chased by fishing trawler and four skiffs

properties.Consequenc: Ship?s stores were stolen

properties.Consequenc: Skiffs approached the tanker aggressively
properties.Action tak: Master took anti-piracy measures, non-essential crew retreated into the citadel, distress message sent and the armed team fired rocket flares and warning shots

properties.Incident d: Six skiffs with 3 to 8 robbers in each approached the LNG tanker underway at speeds between 14 to 20 knots. Weapons were sighted in three skiffs. The skiffs approached and started tailing the ship's stern at a distance of around 200-300 metres. The onboa
properties.Action tak: Security team showed their weapons

properties.Consequenc: On inspection, a new mooring rope was found on the deck partially hacked into small pieces

properties.Action tak: Security team fired warning shots. Master contacted UKMTO. All crew except master, OOW and Helmsman proceeded to citadel.  Master increased ship's speed and altered course

properties.Consequenc: Pirates took hostage seven crew members and hijacked the dhow

properties.Consequenc: The pirates raided all the crew's cabins where they stole cash, personal effects and then stole the ship?s cash

properties.Action tak: Master fired flares, raised alarm and made evasive manoeuvres

properties.Consequenc: Robbers boarded the ship, attacked the crew and stole ship?s stores
properties.Action tak: Alarm raised and all crew mustered

properties.Incident d: Robbers boarded the berthed tanker during cargo operations, stole the fire wire and escaped. Duty A/B on rounds noticed traces of foot prints and noticed the missing fire wire. Alarm raised, authorities were informed and crew did a search, but could not
properties.Consequenc: Robbers boarded the tanker unnoticed and stole the fire wire
properties.Action tak: Raised alarm

properties.Consequenc: Armed pirates in a dhow approached and fired on the ship
properties.Action tak: Master raised alarm and took evasive manoeuvres. Security team exchanged fire with the pirates

properties.Incident d: Armed pirates in a boat chased and fired on the tanker underway from Bonny River. The armed Nigerian navy personnel onboard the tanker exchanged fire with the pirates, resulting in the pirates aborting the attempted attack after 15 minutes of firing. All
properties.Consequenc: Armed pirates in a boat chased and fired on the tanker. The tanker sustained some damage due to the firing
properties.Action tak: The armed Nigerian navy personnel exchanged fire with the pirates

properties.Incident d: Six pirates armed with guns chased and fired on the tanker underway. Master enforced anti-piracy measures and managed to evade the boarding. All crew were reported safe and the tanker sustained some damage due to gun fire.
properties.Consequenc: Pirates armed with guns in a boat chased and fired on the tanker. The tanker sustained some damage due to the firing
properties.Action tak: Master enforced anti-piracy measures

properties.Consequenc: Pirates fired on the ship, causing some damage to the bridge windows and equipment
properties.Action tak: Master raised the alarm, activated SSAS, started main engines and manoeuvred away from the approaching boat. Non-essential crew retreated into the citadel

properties.Consequenc: Some cargo from containers was stolen

properties.Consequenc: Robbers stole one set of fire hose and nozzle
properties.Action tak: Master raised the alarm and reported incident to Port Control

properties.Action tak: Ship increased security measures

properties.Consequenc: Robbers boarded the vessel, threatened the crew and attempted to steal the ship?s stores

properties.Action tak: Master raised the alarm, took evasive manoeuvres and the armed security team fired warning shots

properties.Consequenc: 16 suspects approached the tanker from both sides

properties.Consequenc: Armed robbers boarded and hijacked the tanker.  They took hostage 24 crew members. The ship sustained damages.  Two crew members were reportedly injured

properties.Consequenc: Robbers boarded the ship and took one crew member hostage

properties.Action tak: The alarm was sounded and non-essential crew retreated to the citadel. The onboard armed security team fired one warning shot

properties.Consequenc: Four crew were taken hostage and ship?s property stolen

properties.Consequenc: Nine crew were taken hostage and tied up, some crew were assaulted. The pirates ransacked the cabins, stole ship's property, crew members' cash and personal belongings

properties.Consequenc: No crew reported injured. Twelve pieces of manhole cover and stern light solar cell were stolen

properties.Consequenc: Four crew members kidnapped and taken ashore; crew's personal belongings stolen.

properties.Consequenc: Robbers threatened the mess man and stole engine spares

properties.Action tak: Directed search lights, raised the alarm, and activated fire hoses
